title: Haunting Guise/Liandry's are still way too pricey
body:
For what they do. I'd say for the small subset of champs that Liandry works really well on (dot champs), Guise or the entirety of Liandry should be less pricey. It's no wonder that non-dot champs would pretty much never even try buying the item (maybe Syndra?). It's the same price of Rylai's with 100 less hp, 20 less AP, 15 extra mpen, and a somewhat situational passive compared to Rylai's. Since they're both used in tandem when Liandry is necessary (or just good for the current champ), one amplifies the other, but that's a hefty 6.4k gold. 


One or both of Guise/Liandry has to drop in price, imo.

inb4 this would break dot champs...Come on, they're already pretty ridiculous just by their kit (see: Brand, Malz).

EDIT: I just looked up the changes from back then and Liandry's was 2.9k with 50 AP and a slightly different build path. Now it's 3.2k with **30** more AP...This item's inconsistencies are ridiculous. 300 gold = 30 AP apparently. For Riot liking clean numbers, this item sure isn't clean at all. Before that little 300gold for 30 AP upgrade, it was probably 10-20% less gold efficient than now...At least.

There's also the fact that Liandry's is the best tank buster available to mages, while building out of Guise, that is best _flat_ magic penetration option...

This item _needs_ to be reworked.
This is the problem. The only situation it makes sense for is for busting a tank that for some reason has tons of hp but no MR. Flat Pen and %HP is really awkward.

It's reasonable enough in some scenarios. In particular mages that try to build tanky can end up with a lot of bonus HP and few resistances (ROA, Rylai's and Liandry's isn't the most uncommon combo ever) and juggernauts have tons of HP on their core items but no MR outside of Visage.

> This item _needs_ to be reworked.

Magic penetration in general needs to be reworked.  Voidstaff is basically the pre-rework LW, it's good against everything all the time.  If you want to deal magic damage it must be in your build somewhere.  Meanwhile, like you point out, you have a flat pen item building into an attempted tank melter.

Instead there should be a new %pen component (like LW) that builds into Liandry's and the new AP GW item (don't just randomly toss GW on something that is popular for its stats alone, make it something you intentionally invest in against Mundo/Swain/etc.).  

A flat pen component (whether it's HG or something new) should build into a burst/assassin-mage item that helps a lot for blowing up squishies but doesn't perform as well against tanks.  A properly tweaked Luden's might work.

I'm kind of surprised they didn't do more with magic pen itemization with MYMU, especially since the armor pen changes in preseason worked out so well (IMO).

I agree. You pay 3200 gold for DoT, which does next to 0 dmg to a tank who bought Spectre's Cowl for 1200 gold.
Actually, the dot might even technically HEAL the tank that bought Specter's Cowl.  4 extra seconds of +150% base hp regen means on low hp targets it may just be a heal, not a damage dealing effect.

The Spectre's Cowl "heal" is just an enhanced regeneration effect that's weaker than Visage's constant buff to regeneration. Anyone that ends up at higher HP total due to Spectre's Cowl passive after hit isn't doing enough damage to warrant worrying about.

That is the thing though.  The fact is, Specter's Cowl healing/amplified regen flat out negates Liandry's Burn, to even heals from it at low enough hp levels.  Is it less than Visage's full time HP/5?  Yes.  But it is conditional HP/5 that Liandry's Burn increases the uptime on by an additional 3 seconds.   And its a statement to the fact that a 1200 gold cost item almost flat out counters a 3200 gold item.

**other**

It also is locked into only one build (Liandry's).

I think the health is nice.
If you buy liandry's, it'll be a bit before you can get a defensive item against a assassin or bursty champion.

The offence on it aren't that good compared to other items/item combinations or as flexible.

Until you realise a large chunk of that is from the health which is suuuuper meh at best when your lane opponent is rocking 60 more AP than you because they went for raw AP.

AP+Health cannot go on anything not a max item because they (as stats) are too expensive.

Part of why I think the health should be removed. Nobody buys Haunting guise or Liandry's for the health except maybe Amumu. If they did that they could bring the cost of Haunting Guise down to 1,100. The health is responsible for around 500-600 of Haunting Guise's gold cost.

Gotta keep in mind that this kinda change would be an AP assassin buff, though.

I still think they should leave Guise's cost close to the same and give it CDR (no health) and have Liandry's get a Kindlegem in the recipe (along with a Blasting Wand or something) or just drop the cost (and health) and have Liandry's build out of Kindlegem+Guise+Codex. Either way the health needs to be removed to open up more build paths and Liandry's makes the most sense to be the second 20% CDR item for mages (which Riot has said they want) since it already promoted poke with the %current health and the flat pen.

Haunting Guise is pretty decent though it not building into anything decent for most champions makes it a lot less appealing
Before Runic echoes existed I thought it would've made a great component for a runeglaive replacement if they removed the health and lowered the cost.

It was meant to be used as an answer for characters that stack health, but the damage on the passive is so small that it never really fulfilled that fantasy, especially because so many mages feature AoE (which cuts the already small damage). The only Mage I ever use it on is Malz.

Before the Mage items got looked at further, people only built it because it gave relatively good stats and built out of the premier mid-game item of the time, haunting guise (which now hardly anyone gets because of its cost). With so many better options out there, it has fallen out of favor like a lead brick.

They should honestly rework the item into something that actually works against health stacking targets, because I would much rather just get a void staff over it if ever considering this item. There's a lot of competition in the form of Mage items, so its niche needs to be further defined.
